resources.string: "Congratulations, you've completed the level!\n Different Cultures Discovered Zero at Different Times. The idea of zero as a number was invented throughout the world at different times in history. Despite this scattered adoption, it's generally accepted that the Indian astronomer and mathematician Brahmagupta brought up the concept of zero for the first time, around 600 A.D."

"Congratulations, you've completed the level!\n Zero Is the Only Number That Can't Be Represented In Roman Numerals. sn't a number because you couldn't divide by zero. There are a total of zero zeros in Roman numerals. While the ancient Greeks were aware of zero as a concept, they didn't consider zero to be a number at all. For example, Aristotle decided zero wasn't a number because you couldn't divide by zero. Instead of a Roman numeral, the Latin word "nulla" would have been used to represent the concept of zero. The reason no numeral existed for zero is because there was no need for a numeral to represent it."

"Pandas do not have a special place to sleep - no bed, no nest. Therefore, they fall asleep where they were at the time of fatigue. And if the dream overcame them at the moment when they climbed the tree, well, so be it."

"Brazil is the champion orange growing country. The USA, Mexico, India and Japan are trying to keep up with the record holder. In subtropical Brazil, there are no low temperatures, which contributes to the breakdown of chlorophyll in the peel of the fruit. Therefore, even ripe fruit is both yellow and green. This is hard for consumers to understand, so imported oranges are treated with ethylene to remove chlorophyll and give them an orange color. Thus, color is not an indicator of fruit maturity."
